alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orange (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:42AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cameron, northwestern Jefferson Davis, Beauregard, Calcasieu and southwestern Allen Parishes, southeastern Jefferson and southeastern Orange Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 542 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Merryville to Starks to near Groves. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Port Arthur, Sulphur, Orange, De Ridder, Bridge City, Westlake, West Orange, Vinton, Merryville, Reeves, Dry Creek, Singer, Moss Bluff, Sabine Pass, Johnsons Bayou, Sugartown, De Quincy, Ragley and Lake Charles Regional Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 880 and 877. Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 37. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
